basic.floral_language:
Schefflera impressa
Floriography: optimistic, easygoing, natural
Schefflera impressa is an evergreen foliage plant from tropical or sub-tropical rainforests. Has many branches, tightly arranged with oval, leathery leaflets forming a palm-shape. Ideal environments such as office space, conference room, living room, where the light is not strong.
Resists to half shade, suitable for a place with bright scattered light. With good care, may flower in November-December, yellow-green flowers.
basic.blooming: Foliage plants, sometimes flowers in November-December, yellow green flowers

maintenance.soil: Peat mixed with coarse sand soil
maintenance.sunlight: Relatively resistant to shade, likes half shade environments
maintenance.watering: Likes wet environments, keep it relatively wet rather than dry, reduce watering in winter
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  in March to September, fertilize once to twice a month
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and yellowish leaves timely
